content.detailedDescription:
We were traveling south on route 95 just before exit 4 in massachusetts on our way back to ri from a day in boston. it was about 9pm when we noticed  some lights in a v formation traveling west to east over the highway. my first thought was that they were military jets of some sort. 
 however the formation was not very tight and looked a bit sloppy if i had to say. there were about 5 objects that from our perspective were orange lights that had a bit of a sparkle to them. 
 i ruled out a satellite or planes as the way they were moving seemed odd and were below the clouds. i pulled over in a rest area and got out to get a better look ( there were four other people in the vehicle that also saw this.) the formation of 5 began to diminish in luster and blinked out or faded away. then two more trailing those came over the tree line aprox 60 degrees from the horizon - there wasn't any sound. 
  i took a  video with my blackberry and was able to capture one of these objects. the quality is not too good but it appears to flash or sparkle - not like any aircraft i've seen ( the moon is also in the video). about three more came over the tree line and traveled to the west before they too faded out (all object were moving rather slowly). almost like when a satellite moves out of the sunlight. it was very weird to see this and i immediately thought of how similar it looked to video i've seen of the phoenix lights. the color of these lights were orange and steady - in that they didn't blink like an airplane. i'm not sure what these objects were, but they seemed very out of the ordinary.

Sitting on 2nd story balcony of a friend's condo, with 3 other individuals, having a conversation.  planes in the o'hare (ord) holding pattern were passing by every few minutes.  an object caught my eye, much lower in my field of vision than the planes, and moving in the opposite direction of the typical o'hare bound jet.  immediately, i recognized it as not being an airplane, as it was spherical, and chrome/metallic, very bright from the sun.  it also had a triangular "halo" shape around it.  i felt like my eyes had a hard time focusing on it, which was a strange sensation.  it almost appeared fuzzy around the edge of its shape. it seemed to move fairly quickly, but very smoothly.

 there were quite a few puffy clouds in the sky, and it stayed in front of the clouds as it passed by, so it seemed close, maybe 5-10 blocks away. from what we could tell it was not more than a few hundred feet in the air. it did not appear to be very large.  i shouted out "what is that?", and one of my friends was able to see it as it passed by as well, and gave almost the same description of the object afterward.  our other friend did not have her glasses and could not see it. it traveled on a north east trajectory, and disappeared behind the building. it was actually moving away from o'hare, and toward lake michigan or a northerly direction.

another friend, who was not there, later asked if it could have been a mylar balloon.  i did not think this could be the case because of the fact that it did not waver or flutter, and traveled on a perfectly straight path, beside the fact that it had the previously mentioned optical effect of being hard to focus my eyes on.  we had been watching the planes pass by for a while, and this was in stark contrast to what i saw as far as objects in the sky.  

i felt somewhat befuddled by what i just saw, especially that there were so many jets nearby, and this was quite obviously not a jet, and not a balloon either.  it was not anything common.

my friend who did see the object had a racing heart, she actually made me touch her chest because her heart was pounding so hard.
content.summary: Metallic sphere with triangle outline passed by, low altitude, over nw area of chicago city proper.

content.detailedDescription:
I came home from a neighbors house and took the family dog out for his last potty call of the night. being a star gazer i was looking to the west to see if venus was still visable this late at night. venus had already set below the horizion but another well lit object caught my eye as i scaned the sky for other planets. i looked up to the big dipper and just off the handle was what i thought was another planet. it was as bright as venus has been the last several months as venus sets in the west. at first i was dumbfounded thinking of how i could have missed such a bright planet on previous nights that i had walked into my backyard and looked at the stars. i stood there stairing at the bright object when it started to shrink in size and brightness. the whole process took about 1 1/2 minutes but i have no idea how long this bright object was in the sky before i noticed it. the whole time the object stayed stationary in the sky as it shrunk in size until there was no evidence that it was ever there. i saw the same thing on the next night, 07/18/2010 at aprox 10:10 pm cst but this time it was about 30-40 degrees straight east of the big dipper

this is the 4th time i have seen this strange light the first being about 6 years ago in the late winter and the last before these latest sightings was about 2 years ago in the summer. i have lived in the chicago o'hare since age 1 and i'm now close to 60. i know for a fact that it wasn't an airplane or airplane landing lights, i have grown up with all kinds of airplanes flying overhead and this wasn't a plane. the 3 times i have seen this bright light it seemed to last about the same duration of about 1 1/2 minutes in lenght, the last one about 1 minute. there are no other lights other that the bright white light that stays stationary. the altitude that i see these at is very high so the thought of a helicoptor is out the window too. to describe these the best i can it would be like  you were down at cape canaveral standing under a rocket as it is launched straight up. for a while the rocket engine is very visible but as the rocket gains altitude the rocket engine shrinks in size from very large to just a pin point and then it's gone from sight.
content.summary: Bright star/planet appearing that remained stationary and shrunk in size until it disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend had left for town to pick up some dinner, and called me on the way back, very shaken. she said she was seeing something weird in the south sky. i went out onto the back porch to see if i could see it as well and i could. it was huge. it was a large spherical object with what seemed to be clouds around it. it was orange and there were flashes from what looked like lightning. i quickly checked local weather radar and the lightning map, there was nothing on it within 200 miles of us. it stayed in the same place over the ridge of the valley we live in. the wind was blowing and there was not another cloud in the sky, but this didn't move. it was for the most part stationary for about an hour and then moved away from my location heading southeast. i thought at first that it must have been a lightning storm, but the way it just hovered in place and pulsed orange and flashed blue i discarded that idea. i talked to her on the phone asking her questions till she got back. she saw the object the whole drive back to the house after leaving town. she said she saw it above a corn field moving following the road for awhile. she impressed upon me the size of the object being larger than one of the huge barns out here. i would love confirmation of what i had seen whether it was just an electrical storm or if it was a ufo. tried to get video but by the time i thought about it, the object had finally moved down past the ridge. i have not heard any other people around here talk about it, but it was out in the country after 10:30 at night. (see military and black helicopters all the time out here)
content.summary: Spherical and orange pulsing with clouds and lightning.

content.detailedDescription:
After heading back from a concert at dte in clarkston, mi, my wife and i pulled into our apartment complex.  i had observed very similar events only 3 1/2 weeks ago, so my eyes were focused just above the horizon.  immediately after entering the complex i noticed the lights and said "that's it!" referring to the lights that i told her about nearly a month ago, but she hadn't seen them.  a month ago there were two blue spheres that slowly rose, then quickly dropped below the tree line in a matter of a few seconds, of which a plane and a helicopter are not capable.  this time, there was just one bright blue sphere, or so it appeared at first.  the sphere was more or less hovering in one spot, then it suddenly moved left to right, then up and down.  at this point it was very clear that this was not any sort of technology with which my wife or i was familiar.  the object dropped below the tree line, so i pulled forward to see if i could get a better glimpse of it.  it rose out of the tree line again and at this point i asked my wife to snap some pictures of it since she had her camera for the concert.  she took about 6 or so, but only 1 really turned out.  after realizing that pictures were not turning out great we decided to just watch the object.  it was in the air moving back and forth, up and down and forward and back with incredible ease as if it were doing a dance.  we had thought it was just one sphere, but after closer observation, it was clear that there were at least 3 spheres following each other or rotating around the craft.  it was too high up and too large to be a remote controlled toy and it was too agile to be a plane or helicopter or any other vehicle i know.  also, oakland county is a heavily populated county, so it would be unlikely that any government testing would be going on in this area.  there are multiple airports in the area, but the lights were a bright blue and the craft had incredible abilities, so a plane can be ruled out with certainty.  eventually, the lights went below the horizon for a couple of minutes and my wife and i decided to head inside and look at the pictures.

attached is the one picture that turned out well.  if you zoom in quite a bit it can be seen that there are multiple lights attached to what appears to be a grayish triangular craft.  since it has to be zoomed in quite a bit it is difficult to decipher.  i'll also throw in another that isn't as easily deciphered.  there also can be seen a smaller blue light and red light that are very bright.  not sure what they are.  sphere was a lot larger and close than it appears in the pictures.
content.summary: Multiple blue spheres.

content.detailedDescription: On july 18th 2010 at 21:25 i was sitting in my car in a ralph's parking lot in burbank facing south. i saw the brightest light in the sky and it was green. i was staring right in its direction and  it appeared out of no where. i know how high the mountains in the surrounding area are so i have a pretty good idea how high it was when i first saw it. it appeared out of no where at around seven thousand feet, and fell like a astroid to behind the hollywood sign mountain which is about two thousand feet. this all happened in one second, that is five thousand feet per second, or 3669 miles per hour. i was astonished. i asked my girlfriend if she saw it and she did not. so unfortunately i am the only whiteness
content.summary: Green fireball over los angeles.

content.detailedDescription:
12 images taken in about 2 seconds

zoom 200mm, f8, (images cropped)
content.summary: Glowing objects not visible with the naked eye.

content.detailedDescription:
At about 8:30 on monday, july 12th, 2010 myself and several others witnessed 4 to 6 bright red lights in the sky.  we were camping at lake rudolph campground in santa claus, indiana.  we had just come from the camp ground's ice cream parlor and were enjoying a cone.  while we were walking away, the lights appeared in the sky above the tree line, at about 30 to 40 degrees inclination from the horizon.  the lights appeared as if from nowhere.  at first glance they appeared to be radio tower lights, but they were moving.  they also disappeared and then reappeared.  these lights hovered, but moved slightly in several directions, including left to right and up and down.  they looked similar to flares, but when they reappeared after dimming, and moved in many directions, that thought went away.

i felt a bit perplexed.  the lights didn't fit any description of what i expected to see in the sky at that time.  i was confused by what i saw, as where those witnessing the event with me.  i hadn't thought about it again until today, when a co-worker told me he was camping not far from us in a different campground, at the same time.  he also witnessed the lights as he was leaving a nearby amusement park (about 1/2 mile from my location).  i watched for 2 or 3 minutes.  my wife, who also saw the lights dismissed them as radio towers and walked on.  i did not stay and watch them, but when i got back to my camp sight, several hundred yards from the ice cream stand, the lights were still there.  at that point, i tended the fire and visited with my family.  rather than lose sight, i lost interest in watching them, as they persisted.  i do not know at what point they disappeared or moved off.
content.summary: Several bright red lights appeared one after the other in the sw sky.

content.detailedDescription:
It was app 2 am in the early morning on sat 7-17-2010 at my home. i had let one of my dogs outside to relieve herself. i had walked out on the front porch and then out beside the house on the north side and just stood there looking for her and enjoying the night air. i had not turned any lights on because i like to look at the stars at night and while looking to the east of my house at an app 45degree angle in the sky when i saw this object blinking, or at least that is the best way i can describe it. at first glance i thought it was either a plane or a planet because it was much larger than a star. 

i stood there watching it for a few minutes and determined it was not a plane because it was stationary, then it started moving, back and forth and up and down. the object was shaped like a barrel with a smaller barrel at the top and has more than one color of lights on it. the size of the object was app twice the size of the eraser on a lead pencil. this went on for app and i will say 20m minutes because i felt like i had been there for some time as my legs were getting tired from standing still. i thought about getting my cell phone and trying to take a pic of it and went back on the porch and let my dog in the house. after i let her in i decided to see if it was still there so i walked back across the front porch and out beside the house and looked up again and it was still there. this time it was larger than before but still seemed very far away, how far i would not like to guess because i have no way of estimating. if someone were to ask me to guess and let's say the object was the size of a 747 i would say it was maybe 10 miles away. this time something was different, as i stood there watching it there were some strong feelings of dread that came over me and also like i was being watched. this was a little unsettling so i just went back inside and didn't go back out. i checked the next night at app the same time and nothing was there so, whatever was there the night before was no longer visible.

i do not drink or do drugs so for me to imagine this is not probable. i do not know what it was, only that it was not an airplane or a planet because of the way it moved and because it was not there the next night so due to those two reasons the plane and planet are ruled out. one of you staff may contact me if you would like to do so, but please do that between 9:00am and 4:30pm monday thru friday.
content.summary: I saw this object located at app 10 o'clock in the sky east of me and it moved back and forth and up and down.

content.detailedDescription: At 22h00, i look straight up to the sky and i saw a white sphere moving very fast.
content.summary: White sphere moving.

content.detailedDescription:
at approximately 8pm every night (except on cloudy nights), a star like image descends from space very quickly and hovers in the western sky. moves erratically and flashes white in different directions while a red, green, blue or gold light flashes on top occasionally. sometimes it releases smaller balls of light from below and they shoot off out over the woods in various colors of their own. these smaller ones grow in size as they get closer and continue to hover over the surrounding woods around us while the first one descends out of sight. while the first one is high in the sky, planes fly behind it and i have driven my car 14 miles and have been able to get behind it as well. i have also been chased by it, as i have been driving on various roads such as rt.40. however, when i have tried to get a picture or just stop and observe it vanishes in the blink of an eye.
   1) since this occurs almost every night, i stand in my driveway or on my back steps and wait for it. watching it to see if anything changes.
   2) noticing the object is not a problem for anyone in my neighborhood because; we live in such an open area with not many trees. it was the brightest thing in the sky at the time and moving slowly downward.
   3) i thought it was a helicopter at first. however, upon continuous watching, it releases others from below.
   4) erratic behavior.
   5) all the while during the viewing of the object, my feelings are of want and desire for friendly confrontation.
   6) losing sight of the object is easy. it goes far enough below tree line and or vanishes on the spot.

   also in the past few nights, glowing yellow orbs have been seen floating through the trees approximately 500 to 1000 feet from my home. in the west but, many more in the east. some other colored orbs have been spotted wondering above treetops. causing dogs that live in that area to howl and whine excessively.

   all sightings are witnessed by myself and others of my household.
content.summary: Rotating, flashing, star descends and hovers over western florida sky nightly.

content.detailedDescription: a friend and myself were sitting on my dock around 22:30 on wednesday, july 14, 2010 doing some fishing and observed a satellite pass overhead. while tracking this satellite we unexpectedly observed a very large burst of bright white light that illuminated the whole night sky in the area we were looking. this circle of light resembled a tube with it darker in the center and as we were watching, a large cigar shaped dark object came out of this circle and exited down and out, stopped and made a couple of turns and moved a short distance and come to a stop. after this object came to a stop, the circle of light closed up and went out. the object could not be seen after that point. it was very close to what one has seen in the movies such as stargate and other various movies and tv shows. the whole event was very clear and it lasted around three to four seconds with both of us observing the same thing.
content.summary: Large burst of light, cigar shaped object came out, turned and stoped, light went out.  like a stargate.

content.detailedDescription:
Was taking photos of the night sky on laporte avenue, near the csu foothills campus and this appeared very briefly, perhaps for a second or two.  just a flash of light in an otherwise moonless and dark night at my location.  this 'orb' didn't move, simply appeared and disappeared in the same spot.  


due to the long duration of my camera's exposures, it was able to capture the image.
content.summary: Taking photos of night sky and this appeared on the exposure.

content.detailedDescription: Not first time i've seen something in the sky recently. this was especially odd. i would move my chair to block it out of view and it would move to come right back into sight. i didn't want to see this thing. i am getting a good video camera soon... this white light would remain in one spot. but would move as i moved. i would place a palm tree in front of it and it would quickly move back to where i could see it and begin flashing the top with red lights and then the bottom with red lights. gave me goose bumps. i have seen crazy weird things in the sky over the last month. scariest being two events. one, seemed to be a missile chasing a object and then both just vanished. it seemed the missile object was incinerated. broken down into its basic elements, because it had a strange, light rain-like drizzle falling to my rad after it was gone. 2nd, a odd shadow , shot across the sky in a very quick movement. directly over my home. there was black helicopter flying around my house, in a "grid pattern, i use that term loosely" a few days after, with green, red and blue lights. never seen a helicopter with green or even blue lights before! i have seen and experienced some odd things. and i hate whatever decided to show "this" to me. because when i try to tell my family what happen it is like a joke. so i pretend i'm messing around so they don't think i am loony. happens over plantation, fl(right beside ft.Lauderdale)
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: White light. top and bottom flas red lights. non moving

content.detailedDescription: On the eve of sat 07/17/10 i went outside to have a last cig before going to sleep.  i went out approx 12:30 - 12:45 am (on sun 07/18).  as i was smoking, and listening to the ambient noise i looked up to notice that the night was pretty overcast.  the stars in the night sky were very muted.  upon looking east, i saw 1 light that was very bright, unlike the rest of the sky.  as i was looking at this light i realized that it seemed very low.  it was very far away, but i would guess it's position to be very near phl airport.  in my novice opinion, i would say the altitude was approx 5000ft.  i watched it for approx 45 minutes to 1 hour, and went to bed just past 1:30am.  the light remained motionless the entire time (although occasionally seemed to move side to side, but i attribute that to my tiredness & 47yo eyes).  there was no sound at all.  curiously i only saw one plane during the whole time, which was heading north at very high altitude.  even at high altitude, i could still faintly hear the plane, and even made out the blinking light a few times.  i watched the light for 45 minutes or so, hoping i would see some movement but never did.  i went to bed troubled because it's brightness in the sky seemed so out of place.  i have been checking the sky all night tonight, and although very overcast, it is now 24 hrs later, and there is nothing in that position at all.
content.summary: Bright light near phila airport.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: While outside taking the dog to the bathroom, i looked up and saw a very very small object moving across the sky.  i thought it was a plane at first, and for some reason kept watching it because it left no jet trail and i heard nothing.  it got closer and lower and eventually i could see that it was cigar-shaped. i thought that it was 2 capsule-shaped objects which appeared to be attached, flying end-to-end.  it was high enough to be going through the wispy clouds overhead.  it maintained an even, yet brisk speed.  i could see clearly that there were no wings -- that was what really amazed me.  it was very odd.  it eventually went out of my view because of the houses next door. it was shiny and light-colored, silver. i immediately came in and put it on facebook and tumblr because it was so perplexing --
content.summary: Cigar-shaped object silently flew across the sky.  it had no wings. shiny, with a dark "band" across the middle.

content.detailedDescription:
Okay, i was standing outside watching the sky like i do every night, watch a few star like ufo go by (or what i assume are ufo) when a thought jumped into my head. what if i some ufo's dancing? i somewhat chuckled to myself at the idea. i was staring at the ground pondering on it when i decided to look up. at that exact moment i see a ufo dancing with a star. i call it dancing beacause the star and the ufo were moving in a circle in such a fashion that it was like watching two people waltz from a birds eye veiw. they were rotating closer and further away from each other in a counter clockwise circle until they reach the head of the constellation draco. the ufo departed from the star sending it in the opposite direction; toward its original resting place. the ufo went to the center of draco's head and went up into space dissapearing in the blink of an eye. the star slowly went to where it now resides. i came inside and immediately brought up google earth. i zoom in on draco and come to find out that the star that was dancing with the ufo was actually the foot of the constellation hercules. i am utterly amazed and astonished at what i just witnessed. my initial thought was "how come i thought of a ufo dancing then actually saw one?". im still not entirely sure. was the ufo bending the light of the star? causing it to dance with it in a counter clockwise fashion or did the star actually move? im quite baffled at what i saw and if anyone has any comments or questions you can reach me at kataklyzm0@yahoo.Com and to all you ufo hunters out there.
good luck and keep your eyes on the skies!
content.summary: A ufo and what appears to be a star dancing with each other.

content.detailedDescription: Yesterday i saw and reported the strange sight to mufon that i had experienced.  i decided that i would sit out on my deck at the same time today. i had sat down for no more than 5 minutes when an object appeared to the east of the moon slightly below it this time. it just appeared out of nowhere. i called for my daughter to come see it again.  her friend also observed it. this time the object was moving from east to west at a very slow rate.  we observed it for approx. 30 minutes! my son has a hunting scope that we took out this time and got a very good view of the object. to me it appeared like the top of a jellyfish when i first observed it through the scope and to my daughter it looked like half of a circle with indentations on the bottom portion.  my final observation was when it was westward and about to be obscured by the trees adjacent to our house the it then appeared to be in the shape of a cylinder. it followed the same route as the object we saw yesterday but in the opposite direction.  what is this! my wife also came out and observed it, so thus far i have four other witnesses. please if you are local look in the direction of where the moon was yesterday and today which is in a mid southerly direction at the same time tomorrow and hopefully you to will see this. i wish i had a high resolution video camera so i could capture it on video but i don't. but if anyone reading this does please look in the direction of where the moon will be or had been on the previous days and hopefully with professional equipment to find out what this object is. now i am starting to get weireded out about these events. i really didn't think i was going to see it again.
content.summary: Jellyfish shaped minus the tentacles to cylindrical when it was at another position.

content.detailedDescription:
A strong storm system rolled through the raleigh/durham area of nc tonight and wiped out power in parts of durham for about two hours. within minutes of the power being turned back on, we saw a bright orange light slowly emerge from horizon of the woods and travel over our neighborhood. it was making no sound and as soon as it hit a certain height in the sky immediately started to move faster. within a minute the orange light had become smaller, flashed twice and disappeared. if you held a silver dollar in the sky with your arm straight it would be an approximate size. 

i was wondering if you have any insight into what this could be. there have been numerous reported sightings of orange balls just light this, sometimes during storm systems and sometimes during meteor showers.

we tried taking the best pictures we could. our neighbors saw the same thing and were visibly distraught.  there was no visible tail coming from the light. when we magnified the pictures we saw something very interesting. it looked like there was one orange light and two red lights under it. however that could have been the movement of the camera.
content.summary: Orange orb through night sky.

content.detailedDescription: My lady friend and me were walking home from somewhere.  when we were in the pre-school parking lot i saw my lady friend look up.  then i looked up seconds later, and i saw a perfectly round disc shaped object directly over my head.  as soon as i saw it it was already speeding away straight up.  actually i just got a glimps of it, but could see it had pink and violet swirls on it that seemed to be alive.  it measured about 2 feet in diameter.  it quickly disappeared into space.
content.summary: My lady friend saw it first but said nothing.

content.detailedDescription: I was looking out a west-facing window towards the just fully set sun and noticed an almost invisible black object moving across the sky near venus. the size/distance was hard to gauge, but seemed fairly far, at least hundreds/thousands of feet if not miles. i continually kept my gaze on it having to sometimes re-focus using my peripheral vision as it moved out of sight. it seemed to disappear completely about halfway across my field of vision near to where the moon was in the southern sky, but due to the difficulty in keeping track of it it could have simply faded from visual. it didn't move fast or erratically, just in a lazy/constant/straight nnw to sse trajectory. there were no obvious lights, though at times i could see very faint, erratic and randomly placed white lights but it could have been a trick of the eyes since it was hard to see. definitely didn't appear to be a jetliner or passenger plane. may have been a high-flying bird, stray balloon, or low-flying satellite. identification was essentially impossible. the shape was difficult to make out, at times seeming like a circle/oval/sphere then a triangle/diamond, i attributed this difficulty once again to its size/distance and not necessarily any shape-shifting property.
content.shape: Cone,   Circle,   Diamond,   Oval,   Sphere,   Teardrop,   Triangle,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: Very small black object moving slowly across the western sky.

content.detailedDescription:
My mother lives on a saltwater pond about 1/2 mile width in east falmouth.   she was awoken at 3:20am on 7/2/10 by a very bright ("sparkling like a diamond, but brighter" as she puts it) white star-like radiant object hovering above the tree line across the pond from her house.   she indicates it was the size of a silver dollar if held out at arms length and 4 finger widths above the tree tops.   the light caused a wide v shaped reflection on the pond as if the full moon were shining on the pond but wider.   the sky was clear.   there were no noises.   

the object hovered for approximately 1 minute upon which it moved approximately 1/4 mile to the left (south) and then a 90 degree angle straight vertical into the air and disappeared.    the time elapsed between the moment it started moving, turned 90 degrees vertical and disappeared was approximately 2 seconds.

distance was hard to deduce from our conversation and her experience but her estimates are that it was not too far beyond the trees that start 1/2 mile across the pond from her house.  

i looked on google earth and if a line was drawn from the observation point to the object a few notable landmarks fall on this line in its path disregarding the variable of distance:

1 - sand and gravel pit/mine - lawrence-lynch materials corp. is located directly on the observation line at 396 gifford ave, falmouth, massachusetts.

2 - beebe woods with a kettle pond directly on the observation line.

3 - otis air force base - approximately 6 miles ne of observation point, not on the observation line but interesting.

4 - a large radio tower about 1/3 of a mile south of the observation line.

mufon case 24094 in augusta me witnessed two similar objects hours earlier on 7/1/10 at 10:30pm demonstrate exact same object/s and behavior per my mothers review of that case, but she did not see two objects as that case indicated, just one object.
content.summary: Brilliant dollar coin sized white light cast light on pond, hovering above trees, moved left @ right angle and straight up and disappeared @ supersonic speed.

content.detailedDescription:
On saturday, july 3, my mother and i had been watching the local lake association's fireworks display from the comfort of our living room.  our west window had a perfect view of the fireworks that were launched over the lake.  after the "grand finale" at about 10:40, i got up to put the dog outside one last time for the night, and went our our back door.  i looked up towards the western sky and saw several pairs of bright orange lights moving from the wsw horizon (roughly the "8:00" position) in a nne direction.  the lights were each at least as bright as venus, which was still visible in the western sky at that time.  they just immediately struck me as very odd due to the orange color -- had they been the traditional white/yellow light of airplanes, i would have just assumed it was a group of planes traveling together in some sort of formation.

i immediately called out to my mother "quick, look out the west window, there are ufo's in the sky" -- only half jokingly, because the lights were just so wierd.  at the very same time, my mother was calling out to me "what are those lights?"  they struck her as very odd, too, her comment was "are we being invaded?"

i went outside to get a better look. over the next roughly 10 minutes, there were probably a total of 8 to 9 pairs of these orange lights, traveling from the 8:00 position on the western horizon to the area of the big dipper constellation, which was in the northwestern sky perhaps 3/4ths of the way up from the horizon.  the lights appeared on the horizon generally about every 60 to 90 seconds, and at most times there were probably 2 sets of them visible in the sky.  it took each pair of lights perhaps one and a half to two minutes to move that distance -- they appeared to be rather slow-moving.  

when the lights got quite high in the sky, most of the way towards the region of the big dipper, the lights dimmed and then finally went out entirely and the objects were no longer visible.

at perhaps 10:50, about 10 minutes after the first objects appeared, there were no more to be seen, and i thought they were gone.  after about 5 minutes, another 3 or 4 pairs of objects appeared following the exact same trajectory.  the last of these disappeared and i waited another 2 or 3 minutes and went inside -- i noted it was 11:03 pm when i came inside at that point.

i have no idea how high or how far away these objects were.  when the lights first appeared, i should also note that i could see at least 3 planes in the sky in the same general region of the sky as these lights.  one of the planes was very low, with a single white light and moving from se to nw, possibly to make an approach to oakland pontiac international airport about 3 or 4 miles to the nother.  the other two planes were probably commercial passenger jets -- higher up, and flashing white, red, and green lights, one traveling from the nw to the se, the other very high and traveling almost due west to due east.

the unknown orange objects may have been low enough to be at the altitudes that small private planes fly at, or, for all i know, they may have been in orbit.  i should note that it was a very clear night, and even at that late hour there was still a glow of twilight on the western horizon, so it's possible, i guess, that if these were objects in orbit the light may have been the last rays of the sunlight bouncing off the objects.  i have seen the space shuttle in the international space station before, and those actually move in a similar manner to these unknown objects, but on those, when i saw them, the light was a very yellow light similar to venus, not orange.  so, still kind of odd in my opinion.

i couldn't detect any noise from the objects, but as i said, i have no idea how far away from them i was, and also, it was a very noisy night, with a lot of fireworks and firecrackers still going off, and a noisy party somewhere a street or two over with rock music playing on a p.A. system and people laughging and hollering.  

i find it hard to believe that a lot of people would not have seen these objects.  since it was saturday july 3rd, a great number of people were having parties and get-togethers, and it was a perfect, warm, clear, beautiful evening, and there was a lot of activity in the area, a lot of cars on the road, and so forth.  since over 1.2 million people live in oakland county, michigan, i find it really hard to believe that a lot of people wouldn't have seen these lights, and i find it even harder to believe that they wouldn't have struck others as odd, too.  

i truly don't have a clue what these objects may have been -- some kind of squadron of old planes or ultralites traveling to an air show?  military planes?  had the lights been white/yellow, i would have thought so.  i did ask my brother-in-law, who was a cargo pilot in the airforce during the vietnam era, and who still is a private pilot, and he stated that planes would only have white/yellow lights, plus the blinking red and green wing lights on larger planes, but i suppose even  he could be wrong. satelites?  any that i've seen reflecting the sunlight were a more white/yellow light as well.  so, what they were, i truly don't know.  i just know i haven't seen anything that color before moving like a plane moves, and definitely not in pairs and groups.  i carefully watched the local news that night and for the next few days, checked the local papers, and looked online, because i thought this might be a newsworthy event, or at least someone might offer an explanation of these lights.  since then, i've done a lot of searching online, and i haven't found any references to this event.  it still baffles me because the lights were just such an odd color of orange, so unlike any aircraft i've seen.
content.summary: Groups of bright orange lights traveling from sw to ne.

content.detailedDescription: While lighting fire works one of my children noticed something moving in the sky that was abnormal. my wife and the others took notice while i continued to light firworks, a few minutes after the initial sighting my wife said "hey terry theres your ufo" kinda of making fun of me i stop to look and was astonished by what i was seeing the other adults with me also stop what they were doing to see. it was moving along in the eastern sky from north to south right over south sioux city ne, it was most likely above the missouri river which is about 3miles from my home. i was reddish orange and seemed to pulsesate growing brighter and dimming at a steady pace like breahting. i watched for min called for my daughter to get my camera phone from the house , which she did but by time she came out it was too far gone to see. i dont believe my phone would have produced a quality image any how. the object never took off super fast it just went steady along untill it was not visible any longer. i had not giving it much that thought anymore untill yesterday 7-17-10 when my daughter and her cousin were googling 4th of july ufo sightings , they came to me and showed me that there had almost identical sightings all over the country and even in britian and new zealand, to me this could have been dismissed easily had not been that all the footage i saw and what i have read is almost identical to our experience. pretty intriguing
content.summary: 6-8 people witnessed with me a red to orange orb pass over head for about 6min in duration.

content.detailedDescription: We were in a car driving west on 750 southland st at about 11:20pm. saw a object move from left to right about 60% from the horizon and disappear, it was moving south to north. went home to the corner of poxson and mlk parked north, got out of the car and saw another object traveling south to north about 80% from horizon this one lasted longer about 5 minutes before disappearing behind a cloud. both objects were moving faster than a satellite.
content.summary: Ufo moved from south to north. two  separate incidents.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my deck with my dogs, i looked at the moon and there were 7 sphere,s,,, one had a red orb above it tilting back and forth,,, then i saw more to the rigth of the moon,, thought they were baloons but they were way to high up, i went in to get my camera and when i came out they just disapeared,,, i was wondering if anyone else saw then,, i called 2 news channels but they said i was the only one who saw them.  i know what i seen was,nt ordinary,,, i,d like to know if anyone else saw them? *(wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms).
content.summary: Round spheres to the left and below the moon, many more to the right.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were attending a conference being held in sam's town casino and hotel in las vegas, nevada (5111 boulder highway, las vegas, nv 89122, 702-456-7777).  the conference ran from wednesday, june 23 through friday, june 25, 2010.

after dinner on wednesday, june 23, 2010, my wife and i returned to our eighth floor room around 8:05 pm.  we decided since our room offered a lovely view facing approximately southwest, we would position our two chairs facing the window, prop our feet up on the windowsill and drink our sodas while we watched the sun set.  we began our sunset viewing around 8:15 pm.

at 8:20 pm, i observed a small, dark, circular object moving in an erratic pattern to the southwest.  after observing the object performing rapid directional changes (northwest to southeast) including apparent right-angle turns and apparent hovering behavior, i pointed the object out to my wife who was initially looking north of where i sighted the object.  she immediately was able to see the object in question.

the object soon began to perform amazing flight characteristics including dramatic loss in elevation followed by sudden stops, severe changes in directions and altitude fluctuations, apparent right-angle turns, looping and hovering.  during the first 10 minutes of observation (from approximately 8:20 pm to 8:30 pm) the object appeared to be between 3-4 air miles away from our location.  this distance determination was based on the object appearing in front of structures that were located between interstate 95 to the southwest, and mccarran international airport which was located approximately 4.8 air miles from our hotel.  the object's size appeared to be about half the size of a small airplane, with an apparent diameter of perhaps 10-15 feet.  as the observation continued the object's flight characteristics became even more dramatic.

the object's flight maneuvers included hovering, rapid losses in elevation, continued looping, right-angle turns; however the more we observed the object.......The more we both noticed its shape appeared to be shifting as it traveled over the las vegas area.  the object first appeared as a small, dark gray dot or disc.  as we continued to watch, the object's shape seemed to shift from a disc, to a triangle, to a tear shape.  at several times during the event i observed what looked like bluish smoke around the object, but not smoke you would expect to see from an exhaust.  the bluish "haze" seemed to outline the object as it flew, but would dissipate at times.  i recall noting the only time i observed this bluish haze around the object was during sudden directional change.  sometimes the object would present itself as a triangular feature and apparently tumbled end over end as it flew.  at times, it would also appear to be split down a horizontal long axis with both sides moving almost like the wings of a bird.  the time was now about 8:30 pm, and my wife and i were discussing what this object might be.  we discussed the following possibilities: kite, flock of birds, remote controlled airplane, unmanned military device, ultra-light, small stunt plane, etc.  none of these possibilities seemed to fit the characteristics of the object's motion.  we dismissed all or most of these possibilities based upon these conditions:  there was absolutely no wind that evening...It was dead calm outside, the object was too far away to be a small remote controlled toy, the object shifted shapes as it flew and the possibility of someone conducting tests near a major airport traffic area was unlikely.

from 8:30 pm to 9:00 pm, the object began to gain altitude and move away from us towards the southwest.  the object passed right over mccarron airport because we could observe the planes being between the object and our hotel.  i commented to my wife several times that someone on one of the airliners had to be able to see the object because of their proximity to the object.  during our last 30 minutes of observation, the object moved perhaps 5-6 air miles away from us, and we could no longer observe shape-shifting characteristics or see the bluish haze.  the object did gain several thousand feet in elevation as it moved away from us towards the southwest.  although the local weather was absolutely calm and relatively cloud-free, there was a band of clouds which appeared to be 3-4 thousand feet in elevation and running in a north-south orientation.  during the last 5-10 minutes of our observation, the object gained elevation and continued to move away from us until it disappeared into the cloud bank at approximately 9:00 pm.
i remember telling my wife that i wondered if anyone else with a west-facing room had observed the object from our hotel.  i then excused myself to use the restroom.  while i was in the restroom, i heard my wife utter, "now that is weird".  

post-observation event........At approximately 9:20 pm i asked me wife about her statement.  the following is her personal account of her post-observation event.

*(wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms). observation...

at around 9:10 pm, i heard a loud noise outside our hotel window.  a two-man helicopter equipped with a large search light was hovering about 100 feet from our window, and perhaps one floor above us.  at one point the search light beam was focused on our room.  the helicopter was black, had no markings, and i did observe two people in the craft.  the helicopter circled the hotel twice that i was aware of, and then flew directly to the location my husband and i first observed the mysterious object.  the helicopter flew around the general area where we last saw the object disappear in to the clouds to the southwest.  the helicopter eventually went out of sight and this event ended just prior to my husband returning from the restroom.  he did not observe this event.

final thoughts...

my wife and i waited until 7/18/10 to file this report because we were hoping someone would have reported it before us, and that a logical possibility could be determined for this object and its flight behavior.

during our internet research, my wife located a similar report that a woman filed in the salt lake, utah area.  please visit the attached link for details.

http://naturalplane.Blogspot.Com/2010/05/ufo-possible-thunderbird-sighting-salt.Html

although this report is rather poorly written, my wife and i were amazed how similar this person's sighting was to ours.

please feel free to contact us if we can provide more information.
content.shape: Diamond,   Disc,   Oval,   Sphere,   Teardrop,   Triangle
content.summary: Small, dark, shape-shifting object observed in sky over las vegas for 45 minutes on june 23, 2010.

content.detailedDescription:
For years i've not talked about this(these) event(s).  in fact, after a long career in both military and government meteorology, as well as special upper air contract work on several islands composing the reagan test range in the marshal islands--these were related to a variety of army and nasa programs.

i think someone might be interested in talking over several related ufo experiences i (possibly other career "weather-folk" as well) have had.  most of them cover the time period within the boundaries of my caeer which spanned a period from 1956 through the present.

if not, i'll travel my merry way, so to speak.

sincerely,

*(wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms).
content.summary: Weather observer at greater pitt airport--object approaching east end of main runway.

content.detailedDescription: it was the day after the 4th of july 2009.  me my wife and son where just starting to barb becue when i just looked up it was perfectly calm when i saw what at first thought was a bunch of silver balloons.  they where in a perfect cross formation but what was strange is only one was blinking.  i think that was what caught my attention, but as im watching it i slowly realize that they are a lot bigger than any balloon i have seen before.  also i noticed they where just not moving like balloons i thought they should sway a little but nothing.  i was really close to it and their was nothing holding them together they traveled in an easterly direction and after a half of a mile moved straight up into the clouds the hole time just the one blinked.  never seen any thing travel as such.
content.summary: Multi shiny metal spheres like balloons but very large traveling perfectly then straight up into the clouds.

content.detailedDescription: While i was watching tv i was occasionally looking out my living room window.  one time when i got out of my chair looking outside i saw a brief image of a purple plane without any back wings.  it promptly went behind a tree on my front lawn.  it was only about 55 high.  then minutes later i saw in the south a tiny dot of white light traveling eastward.  it would get big and bright then dim then tiny again...I just stopped watching it, because it greatly resembled the lights i filmed between 2003 to 2005.
content.summary: Why all the ufos?
